p: Molecular tests could be performed on 98.8% (674/682) of DBS. P. falciparum was detected in 17.1% (115/674) of specimens, P. vivax in 0.9% (6/674) and P. malariae in 0.1% (1/674). Among them, three cases of co-infection with P. falciparum and P. vivax were identified. Compared to PCR, malaria RDTs sensitivity was 91.6% [CI95: 85.1–95.9] and specificity was 98.8% [CI95: 97.5–99.5].
